name: Saddle-billed Stork
description: The Saddle-billed Stork is a tall wading bird with a distinctive black and red bill and yellow saddle-like marking.
spread_note: Widespread across sub-Saharan Africa, from Sudan to South Africa.
food_note: Stalks prey in shallow waters with precise strikes.
proportions: Height: up to 1.5 m, wingspan: 2.4-2.7 m, weight: 5-7 kg.
reproduction: Lays 1-3 eggs in a large nest in trees, incubation about 30-35 days.
attractions: Impressive in zoos due to their size and striking appearance.
projects_note: Not currently endangered, but habitat loss is a concern.
breeding: Occasionally bred in captivity for educational purposes.
